duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide first-tier support to end users for PC, server, or mainframe applications and hardware.
Interact with network services, software systems engineering, and/or applications development to restore service and/or correct core problems.
Simulate or recreate user problems to resolve operating difficulties.
Recommend system modifications to reduce user problems.
Follow standard help desk operating procedures to accurately log all requests using the in-house tracking system.
Complete initial client contact and work to quickly resolve issues.
Complete account creation, unlocks, and resets, new computer setup, monitoring of alerts, gather information, and troubleshoot client issues.
Complete basic file restores, basic software and hardware installations.
Monitor and document the status of support requests until a resolution is reached.
Build rapport with various types of business clients.

Previous experience in Microsoft Windows desktop support, remote desktop support, Citrix, Microsoft Server, Microsoft Office products, troubleshooting network connectivity issues, Active Directory, back-up solutions, Apple products, and mobile device support is a plus.
Willingness to work overtime, nights, weekends, holidays, and on-call schedule.
Reliability and ability to handle stressful situations and carry up to 40 lbs.

education_certification.credential: High School diploma or GED. Associate’s degree in computer science or business is preferred but not required. Technical field certifications and educational certifications are a plus.
